actor_awards.notes: She achieved the 'Triple Crown of Acting' (Oscar, Tony, Emmy). Best known for her iconic role as Mrs. Robinson in 'The Graduate' and her Oscar-winning performance as Annie Sullivan in 'The Miracle Worker', a role she originated on Broadway.

filmography.title: The Miracle Worker
filmography.role_description: The partially blind, determined teacher who breaks through the isolation of young, deaf-blind Helen Keller.
filmography.plot: The story of Anne Sullivan's struggle to teach the blind and deaf Helen Keller how to communicate.

filmography.title: The Graduate
filmography.role_description: A bored, alcoholic housewife who seduces her neighbors' son, Benjamin Braddock.
filmography.plot: A disillusioned college graduate finds himself torn between his older lover and her daughter.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; AFI: 100 Years...100 Movies

filmography.title: The Pumpkin Eater
filmography.role_description: A woman suffering from depression who finds her third marriage crumbling due to infidelity.
filmography.plot: A mother of many children finds herself in a breaking marriage and struggles with her mental health.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: The Turning Point
filmography.role_description: An aging prima ballerina who reunites with a former colleague who chose family life over a career.
filmography.plot: Two former ballet dancers reunite, sparking old rivalries and examining the choices they made in their lives.

filmography.title: Agnes of God
filmography.role_description: The Mother Superior of a convent who clashes with a court psychiatrist over a novice nun accused of infanticide.
filmography.plot: A naive novice nun is discovered with a dead newborn in her convent cell, leading to a clash between the Mother Superior and a psychiatrist.

filmography.title: The Elephant Man
filmography.role_description: A famous actress who befriends John Merrick and treats him with dignity and kindness.
filmography.plot: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak.

filmography.title: 84 Charing Cross Road
filmography.role_description: A sharp-witted American writer who develops a long-distance friendship with a British bookseller.
filmography.plot: True story of the transatlantic business correspondence about books that developed into a close friendship.

filmography.title: To Be or Not to Be
filmography.role_description: A Polish stage actress who, along with her husband, gets involved in a plot to deceive the Nazis.
filmography.plot: A theater troupe in Nazi-occupied Poland uses their acting skills to fool the Germans and save the Resistance.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Garbo Talks
filmography.role_description: A dying woman whose final wish is to meet her idol, Greta Garbo.
filmography.plot: A son tries to fulfill his dying mother's wish to meet the reclusive screen legend Greta Garbo.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: The Prisoner of Second Avenue
filmography.role_description: The supportive wife of a man having a nervous breakdown in New York City.
filmography.plot: A New York couple struggles with the stresses of city life, unemployment, and a heat wave.

filmography.title: Don't Bother to Knock
filmography.role_description: A hotel lounge singer who is the ex-girlfriend of the airline pilot protagonist.
filmography.plot: A pilot tries to win back his former girlfriend while dealing with a mentally unstable babysitter at the same hotel.

filmography.title: The Slender Thread
filmography.role_description: A suicidal woman who calls a crisis center and talks to a volunteer played by Sidney Poitier.
filmography.plot: A crisis center volunteer tries to keep a woman on the phone long enough to trace the call and save her from a drug overdose.

filmography.title: Young Winston
filmography.role_description: The American-born mother of Winston Churchill.
filmography.plot: The early life and career of Winston Churchill, from his childhood to his time as a war correspondent and politician.

filmography.title: 7 Women
filmography.role_description: A cynical, chain-smoking doctor who arrives at a remote mission in China.
filmography.plot: In 1935 China, a female doctor sacrifices herself to save the women of a mission from a Mongolian warlord.

filmography.title: Home for the Holidays
filmography.role_description: The quirky and slightly overbearing mother of a dysfunctional family gathering for Thanksgiving.
filmography.plot: A single mother travels home for a chaotic Thanksgiving dinner with her eccentric family.

filmography.title: Fatso
filmography.role_description: The sister of the main character who struggles with obesity. Bancroft also wrote and directed this film.
filmography.plot: A man struggles with his weight and tries to find love and acceptance with the help of his family and a support group.

filmography.title: Great Expectations
filmography.role_description: A modern re-imagining of the Miss Havisham character, eccentric and wealthy.
filmography.plot: A modern retelling of Dickens' classic story about a young man's journey to adulthood and his obsession with an icy beauty.

filmography.title: Antz
filmography.role_description: The voice of the Queen Ant, mother of Princess Bala.
filmography.plot: A neurotic worker ant tries to break from his totalitarian society and win the heart of the princess.

filmography.title: Heartbreakers
filmography.role_description: An eccentric wealthy woman who becomes a mark for a mother-daughter con team.
filmography.plot: A mother and daughter con team seduce and scam wealthy men, but complications arise when the daughter falls in love.

filmography.title: G.I. Jane
filmography.role_description: A tough, political senator who pushes for gender integration in the Navy SEALs.
filmography.plot: A female Lieutenant is given the chance to earn a place in the elite Navy SEALs, facing grueling training and political maneuvering.

filmography.title: Point of No Return
filmography.role_description: A refined operative who teaches the protagonist etiquette and social skills.
filmography.plot: A drug addict is transformed into a government assassin but struggles to balance her deadly career with her personal life.

filmography.title: Malice
filmography.role_description: A key witness in a deposition involving a complex medical malpractice case.
filmography.plot: A tale about a happily married couple who would like to have children and a surgeon who moves into their lives.

filmography.title: How to Make an American Quilt
filmography.role_description: One of the quilting circle members, known for her artistic spirit and past secrets.
filmography.plot: A bride-to-be visits her grandmother and great-aunt, where she learns life lessons from a quilting circle.
filmography.awards: Screen Actors Guild: Nomination – Outstanding Performance by a Cast

filmography.title: Silent Movie
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance in Mel Brooks' homage to silent films.
filmography.plot: A film director and his friends try to save a movie studio by making a silent movie with big stars.

filmography.title: Honeymoon in Vegas
filmography.role_description: The dying mother of the protagonist who makes him promise never to get married.
filmography.plot: A man loses his fiancée in a poker game to a professional gambler and must chase them to Las Vegas to win her back.

filmography.title: Dracula: Dead and Loving It
filmography.role_description: A gypsy woman who warns about vampires in this Mel Brooks parody.
filmography.plot: Mel Brooks' parody of the classic vampire story and its famous film adaptations.

filmography.title: Up at the Villa
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated aristocrat in pre-WWII Florence.
filmography.plot: A young English widow in 1938 Florence faces a dilemma when she accepts a marriage proposal but then commits a rash act.
